result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 10/16/2014:  Order amending judgment of conviction to correct the statute which the defendant plead guilty to from 961.41(3g)(e) to 961.41(3g)(b).

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court ordered costs be entered as a civil judgment.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 14CF8

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction.
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Cody A. Miller in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  State moved to amend charge to misdemeanor possession of controlled substance 961.41(3g)(e).  Motion granted.  DE entered a plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  No further comment by the state; brief statement by Attorney Wolff.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for one year with the following conditions:  pay court costs and DNA surcharge; undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Motion hearing on September 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Cody A. Miller in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
